job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Appleton, WI

cons: 2 certain floors are very rude and unfriendly. Management does not care about you. Severely underpaid and overworked. Also work for a "Catholic" Hospital, but yet somehow dont recognize Easter as a holiday?

pros: Nothing is a pro about this hell hole

pros: I do not have anything to say

job_title: Social Worker in East Birmingham, AL
pros: The staff I worked with are dedicated and genuinely care about the patients. Great people working in a difficult environment.
cons: The behavior of my direct supervisor was inappropriate. Her vulgar, demeaning and degrading comments to me regarding her director, and other staff members was a contributing factor to my brief employment. No employee should ever be subjected to bullying nor the behavior I experienced, unfortunately, this has been ongoing for years. I am the 8th social worker to leave this department in 7 years. Shameful behavior for a Catholic hospital.

job_title: Front Desk Coordinator in Hilliard, FL
pros: Decent pay, benefits, and schedule.
cons: This isn’t health care anymore, it’s strictly to make money.

cons: Hardly any raises and poor management.

pros: competitive wage and knowledge of current medical standards of care.

review_title: Terminated for not reviewing covid-19 vaccine

job_title: Environmental Services in Mountain View, AR
pros: good place to work at.
cons: none that I can think of

pros: Good co working environment, helpful
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Working with the public and making a difference in someone's life is the most rewarding experience.  This job allows you to do that every day. The associates are friendly and fun to work with.  It's close to home.
cons: Management continues to run things in a superannuated fashion. They are unwilling to change their management style, which can be manipulative and authoritarian, to a more modernized democratic approach of hearing what their associate's recommend for a better workflow and patient care experience. Who better to give advice on necessary changes than those who work with the patients face to face everyday?

review_title: Once loved it, now barely recognize the place
pros: When I started at St. Vincent several years ago, I really liked it. The work wasn't always exciting, but I felt valued and loved my co-workers. And I felt like the work I did had meaning. I rarely worked overtime and had a decent starting salary and raises the first few years.
cons: Since Ascension has taken over, it's just awful. It's cold, management is either evasive or clueless or unfeeling...or all of the above. There's no loyalty, and no one I worked with felt their job was safe. No one felt valued. Raises and bonuses which once were solid are now rare and pathetic, if they exist at all.

review_title: St. Mary's used to be a good, stable place to work. Times have changed. Don't waste your time.
pros: Pretty location and facility. Faith based with a nice chapel for employees, patients and guests. Opportunity to continue education. Good nurses. Good doctors. For convenience employees have access to use/join: a nice fitness center, a good cafeteria with decent food, an apothecary, and shops.
cons: Weak, overpaid, rude, and inadequate management. Underpaid employees. Terrible benefits that are very expensive. No pension, raises or annual bonus (unless you are in management & then you will get a big performance bonus on top of a big salary) No fairness. No job security. Not true to their mission. No place to park.

review_title: Would be a great place if they would hire good managers, manage what they have.
pros: Top pay in Indy, benefits
cons: Bad management - they have their managers over too many locations, and they are scattered, clueless about their departments, or delegate too much to staff that should be focused on their patients. Too many changes - eliminating staff that is needed makes it's too hard on the staff that's left.

review_title: Pharmacy Technician. W 86th St Indianapolis location is HORRIBLE.  Don't do it!
job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Pay is pretty good. benefits are okay. Co-Workers great for the most part. I have to have 20 words of pros and it was hard to make it there.
cons: Absolutely NO management going on here. Within your first week you are on your own.  I was there for 3 months and still didn't know all of my co-workers names because it is not a welcoming environment. There are no introductions unless you make them yourself. Routes that are you sensible. Not throughly trained. Some co-workers at been there a month & still hadn't been trained in certain areas but then are scheduled to work those areas without help.  Tech Supervisors have no idea what the other Tech Supervisors have going on or said. It's Mass chaos. Don't do it. Try a different location.

review_title: St. Mary's is a good place to work.
pros: The hours are good in my position I only work what I have agreed to in my position.  Insurance is offered to part-time employees.  Doctors and staff work well together.  The hospital is in a good location for daily commute to work.  Education for staff is available on site for certification in advanced roles.  Overall a good and fair employer.
cons: Cost of living raises are rare and have not occurred for years.  As usual staffing needs to be increased.  Mandatory overtime is hidden in on-call being added to the employee schedule.  This is in my department, I am not sure how other areas handle this.

pros: You get to work with some great people through the entire company. That would be the biggest upside to working here. The unfortunate truth is that it makes the corporate culture more tolerable if you are suffering with people rather than alone. You will grow your skill set in any department you work in.
cons:
You are used like a piece of meat, much is expected but nothing is given back. The dollar is the bottom line and that fact is hidden under the guise of doing more for less in the name of patient care and honoring core values. Empty promises of raises and bonuses, but be sure they will cut anything they can. 

Be assured you have no voice here despite what you are told...

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Patients are the main reason to love working with Ascension.  Employee perks are well worth it! St Vincent Heart Center is the best location to work, same system not the drama!
cons: MDs do not have a lot of say within their departments.  Private practice is a thing of the past.  St Vincent merging with other practices quickly was not thought out very well, new computer system that does not fit each practice...not good

pros: This is (or was) a mission-minded organization committed to serving the poor and less fortunate.  It could be a shining example of how healthcare should be for the entire country.
cons: The organization is very top-heavy, and has been purchased by a national health organization, Ascension Health.  Lots of "management" at a loss for what to do, lacking leadership and vision.  Most change comes down as a directive from Ascension and the individual hospitals get lost in the shuffle.  The ones who stay in power are the narcissistic types who are only expert at keeping power.

review_title: Great when it was st vincent
pros: at first we could wear jeans and sneakers since we didn"t see patients. the best part is the flex schedule which allow me to work 4 ten hour days and have fridays off. they didn't give us raises and bonuses for a couple of years but after ascension took over they gave us small raises and bonuses
cons: after ascension took over they hired Accretive Health (R1 RCM) and things changed for the worse.  management never knew what was going on and our job future unsure. managers were more worried about production then quality.

review_title: School Health Based Program. (School Health Nurse/Assistant)
pros:
St Vincent Pros- Faith-Based, Community Driven, Financial Assistance, Educational Perks 
School Health Pros- A traditional Monday- Friday schedule, Working closely with Children
cons: Pay is much lower than if my position was in the hospital. School Health problems are often ignored. Sometimes feeling like you don't belong within the school and you don't belong within the hospital. Very low raises sometimes not at all. Even if you get an amazing review.

review_title: I like the environment and the people that I wrork with on the unit that I work on. We are like a family.
pros: I like working with this company because we work as a team. When someone needs to take time off work, we share the responsibility of covering the shift that the person can not work. Also, when someone has something to celebrate or experiencing a difficult situation, we support that person.
cons: Having to deal with the atttitudes of some of the workers who don't want to be at work and they want you to feel misery with them.

pros: There is a wide variety of jobs to perform, so generally speaking you won't be bored or stuck in a routine. Benefits are decent and pay is adequate
cons: Incompetent/malicious management, staffing issues (consistently 4-5 people short, and constant  call-ins result in frequent increased workloads), bureaucratic infighting (cannot often complete functions of your job in an efficient manner due to different departments not wanting to cooperate for undisclosed reasons), and poorly timed rotating shifts (frequently will be scheduled for a 7a-3p shift after a 3p-11p shift).

job_title: RN Case Manager in Indianapolis, IN
pros: My coworkers are amazing. They are very knowledgable and helpful. We truly work as a team which is important due to the short staffing.
cons: Understaffed! The workload is too much for the staff that we have. Management is overwhelmed, disorganized and they seem like they are not listening to the concerns of the staff. The pay scale is poor compared to other hospitals. Turn over is high.

review_title: Good overall, could use some improvement
job_title: Patient Financial Services in Indianapolis, IN
pros: The culture is great and employer focuses on the community and patient satisfaction. Lots of diversity and plenty of room to advance and learn more. Health insurance cost is low. Great PTO benefit if you are exempt (salaried). Great training program.
cons: Pay is just OK and not very competitive.  Management moves slow at times, lacking in communication especially between departments. High turn over in AR and Customer Service departments.

pros: They paid me well. They are poor negotiators. The managers do not know what they are doing so oversight is minimal(at least initially)
cons: They will make promises they cannot keep. They provide expensive, unnecessary office equipment(I guess due to fact they have a lot of money's and it makes them feel like they are doing something)! The individuals who run the offices are business oriented and have no idea what good patient care is. They preach to have a caring environment but the treat employees terrible. There is nothing genuine about management. I know a great number of physicians who left after same experience. A downer experience. I never imagined they could take a great practice and destroy it so easily.

pros: Shared governance and staff-driven committees for nearly every aspect of the work experience mean staff opinions are heard and accounted for. Physicians are respectful of staff opinions and initiation of protocols, which allows for better patient care and promotes a feeling of value among RN's and other allied health staff.
cons: Increasing push to critique patient care based on 'customer satisfaction' instead of actual patient needs, short-staffing and high turnover lead to catty attitudes in an environment that's stressful enough already. Insurance and benefits seemed to change hands several times over a short period, making them difficult to keep track of and requiring me to switch providers twice. Salaries are low compared to area competitors.

pros: Fair pay,  option to work a full time job and a prn job both, good bonuses
cons: Poor communicating,  too much outsourcing, no job security you never know when you might walk in to work and find out it's your last day because your job has been eliminated.  Seen this one too many times.

pros: Christian work environment.  Everyone trying to implement the key elements of Christ's mission in medicine.  Diverse work opportunities from large teaching hospital to small town critical access hospitals.  Athena EMR is excellent as EMRs go.
cons: Administration a lot less progressive than "physician lead" would indicate.  Many physicians feel disenfranchised as a result.  Sometimes bureaucracies make decisions that directly affect the practice of a  physician without even consulting with them beforehand.

pros: Collegiality was great.  .  This decreased a bit after Ascension took over and the nuns left.  Benefits were good including 401 match and pension
cons: Ascension takeover centralized HR, IT and Supply Chain and added significant bureaucratic burden.  Met a current employee a in June 2017 and allegedly bureaucracy is worse than ever.  Decisions were never made or were significantly delayed due to centralization.  Leadership seemed to stagnate for a time.  A number of leaders lost their jobs due to the takeover or left for other jobs.

review_title: Overall, enjoyed the experience of working with nurses who care not only for pt. but for each other.
job_title: License Practical Nurse in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Benefits were good.  Loved the work hours 7a-7p
cons: Too much politics and less concern for pt. care.  Short-staffed all the time. The managers and Ceo of company more concerned about policy than want is needed to staff their hospital.

review_title: Working at St. Vincent Health gave me valuable skills and experience.  It was a good place to work.
pros: The organization is sensitive to the individual's personal values and offer the employee opportunities to share in the decision making process.
cons: Due to the drastic change in medical reimbursements and the numerous locations for patient care, cost has overshadowed many of the perks once offered to employees.  Job reduction is prevalent at this time.

review_title: good and bad, but overall i wouldn't go back
pros: Wonderful benefits and even programs to provide insurance to employees during financial hardship.  The spirit and mission are worth believing in.
cons: The compensation was very poor.  Some might consider other benefits as adequate overall compensation.  There was not much ability to move up and lots of people were being let go at the time (2010).

pros: Was a great company to work for and lots of growth opportunities in cross-training.
cons: St. Vincent Hospice went down hill once they decided to part from it's main source, St. Vincent Hospital, in order to be an independent facility. They merged with another company, benefits plunged as costs skyrocketed, and huge layoffs as they spent more money on restructuring processes that were recently restructured. Talk about a waste of money and resources, as well as time.

review_title: Work with a Mission and Purpose
pros: As part of the Ascension Catholic healthcare system, the mission to serve the poor and vulnerable is at the core of everything.  Leadership maintains ties to roots while making strategic aims for organization to lead healthcare change to positively impact individuals and whole communities.
cons: Current healthcare climate means lots of changes and challenges to operate leaner and more efficiently can be overwhelming.  Lots of changes in recent years has left some staff feeling fatigued.

review_title: Long term employee unhappy with changes
pros: The Spirit of Caring is evident with the docs, nurses and most employees with direct patient contact.  Employees treat each other like family but most importantly the patient is the number one priority
cons: Managers and Directors seem disinterested in the issues their subordinates face in their daily work.  Problem solving is done without the input from the actual workers and therefore ineffective. There seems to be a disconnect between management and workers-a "them" vs "us" mentality.

pros: Great co-workers.  I would not make it through a single shift without these people.
cons: Upper management offers less and less support with more responsibilities and expected of you.  Lots of frequent turnover and understaffing.  Sunrise clinical manager charting software isn't intuitive or user friendly.  Easily my least favorite EHR to work with.  More and more focus on budgets when CEO makes over 17.7 million dollars per year.

review_title: St. Vincent Hospital, not a bad place to work
pros: Strong business sense.  Making top profit margin compared to other hospitals in the area.  Well known, well liked in the community.
cons: Excess middle management.  It's more of a business now.  Used to be more personalized for patients, families and staff.  Don't give "cost of living" raises.  This at a time when cost of living has increased tremendously.

pros: Health care viewed as a ministry at best. Worked with many extremely kind and compassionate individuals.
cons: They brought in a corporate consulting team from Ascension Health and started performing a reorganization of the hospital. That resulted in layoffs and a great deal of confusion. It happened at least twice during my years with the hospital.

review_title: Call Center Associate who called and contacted former patients to raise money for The Hospital Foundation.
job_title: Call Center Specialist in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Talking with former St. Vincent patients about the great services St. Vincent provided them, and offers for the poor and the sick. Fundraising for excellent contributor to our community. Few people realize the Mission of the Foundation and Hospital and all the care it provides for individuals.
cons: Position was only available in the evening hours.

pros: Faith aspects.  Good work/life balance promotion.  Great employees and culture.  Many of the managers were very approachable and friendly
cons: There was a lot of turnover at the corporate location.  There was sometimes a lack of a community feeling at also at the corporate location.  I overall had a great experience though.

review_title: Extremely Disappointed and Disgusted Medical Assistant
pros: My coworkers were amazing we had a great work relationship we treated each other like family overall the clinic was clean
cons: Management was unbelievably rude, conniving and disrespectful; the complete opposite of St Vincent / Ascension's Mission and Values

job_title: Talent Acquisition Advisor in Evansville, IN
pros:
Love that Ascension is a faith-based Healthcare organization. Each meeting begins with prayer.
Co-workers respect each other and form great teams.
Communication with manager is open and honest. 
Great benefits!
cons: The communication channels from top down needed improvement. That has gotten so much better in the last year with frequent Town Halls and frequent emails from leadership.

review_title: I hope they turn it around
pros: Great co-workers, good retirement fund, close to my home. (I had to write 20 words)
cons: Severely Understaffed, becoming corporate minded, no containing education money for mid level providers. 1% raise past few years. Used to get "Share the Vision" bonus. I think since the nuns left the vision has been forgotten.

review_title: I have worked for this company for many years and it has always provided well for my family and me.
pros: It is a smaller, hometown hospital that feels like a second home.
cons: Since it is a smaller hospital, the pay may not be up to speed with a larger hospital.

pros: Great mission, loved the other employees, wide range of opportunities within the system, great benefits and consideration for the needs of the employees
cons: There is constant turnover at the hospitals and corporate, there is a lot of new management constantly, sometimes the culture lacks the collaborative feel of many companites today

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great pay compared to other hospitals around the area, hours are available to work. Prn staff makes a lot of money
cons: Always short handed and the management isn't always there to help you out. They know we're short staffed and will look at the prescriptions print and not do anything about it

pros: Good people, Good training, Mission Oriented staff and physicians
cons: Upper management seemed to be oriented only on quarterly production and have abandoned meaningful attention to mission.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Evansville, IN
pros:
- Great co-workers in various areas
- Typically receive an annual raise or small bonus
- Decent insurance benefits
cons:
- Variability in standards of conduct, competence and professionalism of management by department
- History of unannounced 'budget cuts' resulting in terminating positions and entire departments without warning

pros: No weekends, no holidays, I'm lucky that I work in a great office where everyone is like a family. I enjoy working with my coworkers.
cons: Working with the public Can be very demanding at times, healthcare is always changing. Fifteen sixteen seventeen eighteen nineteen twenty.

pros: Plenty of chances for advancement. Great benefit package. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. St Vincent treats staff and patients with great respect. Organization has a great reputation in the community. I gelt pride in working there.
cons: Very difficult to hire new staff - but perhaps that is true anywhere you go these days. I can't really think of any other cons. It's a great place to work.

pros: Good pay for the area, steady job that is hard to get fired from, not a difficult task level to maintain.
cons: Very difficult to get promoted, everyone gets the same raise (no matter the effort level), seasoned co-workers are lazy.

review_title: Outsourcing as fast as they can. Prospective employees, run for the hills!
pros: I loved my job.  I loved my local job, answering to local supervisors and being able to find local help for patients with billing concerns.  It wasn't a bad job until they decided to send all clerical employees to another company they own, R1RCM.  Now after transferring the local St Vincent staff to R1RCM employees, they are outsourcing all possible clerical conditions to India, where labor is cheap.  You can't speak up or ask for fair wages or bring attention to yourself at all because then you are next to go!  Nurses, you are not safe either.  They demand extreme physical labor at unfair wages and if you complain, a new graduate nurse is cheaper to them anyway...they won't shed a tear after they cut you loose!
cons: If you have a job today, you probably won't tomorrow.  There is no one to ask questions to or dispute pay.  There is no one to direct patients to on a local level.  I heard they are bringing the call center back to Evansville from Indianapolis now because the feedback has been so poor. That's a shame because they lost a ton of good employees when they eliminated their jobs months ago.  Loyalty and years of service mean nothing to Ascension Health.  You are not an employee, you are a number.

pros: Team members are extremely resilient and get the work done.
cons: Cuts to staff, cuts to continued education, cuts to staff benefits (cafeteria discounts, parking, health insurance options, etc.), communication between departments

job_title: Radiology Information Assistant in Brookfield, MA
pros: Got along with the patients, my coworkers, and the supervisors great!
cons: The job was boring a lot of the time. Made the day go by slow. They didn't challenge you like other work places do.

review_title: Great short term option employer for Nurses
pros: Fairly straight forward application and interview process for short term assignments. Local staff was very supportive of me coming and working at St Vincent, Anderson's CCU.
cons: Small facility, be ready to float to other med-surgical floors. Must be flexible with schedule to get extra hours.

pros: Great insurance, work at least half day get full day credit
cons: Contract is 3 years with no raises until next negotiated contract. Managers don’t keep employees well informed. Won’t prorate bonus if available your first year.

pros: I found my time at St. V's to be like having an extended family. They took great interest in me as a person and were committed to my personal and professional development. They truly live their mission out on a daily basis.
cons: They often acquire other facilities, which requires cuts within the organization that leave people without positions to transfer.

pros: My co-workers who always have the customer and patient in mind. Did their best without a lot of support. Benefits similar to other employers.
cons: Ascension Health is taking over and support departments are being reduced or outsourced. Marketing, Revenue Cycle and Human Resources next. Corporate culture now that the sisters are gone managers have no say or input to decisions.

pros: Great staff in a spiritual environment.  Recent rough changes but they are just trying to survive this crazy health care system we live in.  Able to work in any facility with the same supplies, processes, this facilitates any moves in location being easier.
cons: changes from above are not always the smartest changes.

review_title: Working at PMCH at St Vincent.
pros: Physician nurse relationships are great. MDs really appreciate our input. Their is a lot of autonomy. We have great MDs there.
cons: Studer Group is at St. Vincent. They are bringing their kool aid and want us to drink it. A lot of time, energy is being emphasized on customer service.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Evansville, IN
pros: All staff are very friendly. Everyone works together to solve problems. By far my favorite employer so far!
cons: Office morale was not always at the highest because we had a lot of turnover. We did not have turnover because the environment was bad, rather many younger employees graduated college and found other opportunities.

job_title: Representative, Unit Support in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Working for a catholic hospital is wonderful. At least once each 12-hour shift we are invited to participate in a prayer. This reminds us to be mindful of where we work and who is our focus.
cons: One downside is that the cost of healthcare can sometimes outweigh the availability and choices.

pros: Very caring people, good work atmosphere and lots of flexibility.
cons: Strategic objectives are not always well communicated.  Communication style is very top down.

review_title: Good benefits, good pay, great coworkers
pros: Medical benefits are all great, bonuses at the end of the year for everyone, HR is cooperative.
cons: Nothing in particular other than that medical staff usually end up getting to make security decisions over our heads because they get uncomfortable.

pros: St. Vincent has great Core Values. I enjoyed working there and learned a great deal. I was an employee for about 5 years.
cons: There is a lot of change that is taking place in the healthcare industry.  Given such change, St. Vincent is also going through various changes.

job_title: Sports Performance Certified Athletic Trainer in Indianapolis, IN
pros: They have a broad reach in the community.
cons: Pay is very low comparatively.  The change in management has not been a good change.  I feel I am just a worker who can be disposed of at any moment.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Room for autonomy, management is not looking over your shoulder as long as work is completed efficiently throughout the day.
cons: Short-staffed. Case managers have too many patients and become overwhelmed.

pros: Great culture, associate's opinion matters, Relationship Based Care for self, coworkers, patients, and family members, high quality care and focus on patient centered care, opportunities for personal growth and career growth, good benefits, dedicated to their mission
cons: Desire for more cross-departments interaction

pros: Magnet Hospital status  for one year compliance.  Comprehensive new staff training.
cons:
Benefit package specific for Ascension Health system as key providers.
Pay freeze for 2 years of 5 worked.
